item.title: Lit Buildings Have Near Infinite Bandwidth
item.description:
By: John Shepler When choosing a business location, consider “lit buildings” for their exceptional connectivity. These buildings are already equipped with fiber optic internet infrastructure, offering a solution to bandwidth concerns. What Does “Lit Building” Mean? “Lit building” signifies a building pre-wired for fiber optic internet and potentially point-to-point bandwidth services. The term “lit” references the laser beams used to transmit digital signals at high speeds through fiber optic cables...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/lit-buildings-have-near-infinite-bandwidth/

item.title: Is It Time To Go Fiber Optic Internet?
item.description:
By: John Shepler Have you found that your internet service, once reliable, can no longer keep up with your growing business? If a slow connection is impacting productivity and increasing frustration, it’s time for an upgrade. But what are your options? More Choices, Less Cost Shopping for internet access may seem daunting, especially if your last experience was limited and expensive. You might have settled for a T1 line, DSL from the phone company, or business cable from your TV provider...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-it-time-to-go-fiber-optic-internet/

item.title: SIP Trunks vs ISDN PRI
item.description:
Businesses have moved past analog phone lines, embracing PBX systems and ISDN PRI for their communication needs. However, there’s a new player in town: SIP Trunking. This technology offers potential cost and performance benefits for companies looking to enhance their voice services. Let’s compare SIP Trunks with ISDN PRI to understand the best choice for your organization. It’s important to note that both technologies rely on digital telephony, eliminating analog transmission...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/sip-trunks-vs-isdn-pri/

Small businesses find it distracting, while larger companies view it as a costly endeavor that can either help or hurt their efficiency. Integrating local and wide area networks seamlessly is a particularly difficult problem. Fortunately, there’s a solution: Telarus. Regardless of your size or technical expertise, Telarus provides a range of services to address your networking needs...

item.title: Free Help On Your Telecom Needs
item.description:
Want free, top-notch tech support for your phone and computer networks? No cost now or ever, even with today’s tight budgets. Sounds too good to be true? It’s not. This is a telecom brokerage service with a team of experts in telephony, computer networking, international networks, wireless solutions, and more. item.title: Disaster Recovery Is Now a Service
item.description:
Imagine a sweltering day with an unsettling stillness in the air, the kind that foreshadows trouble. Suddenly, the sky darkens, wind howls, and a deafening roar consumes everything. You seek shelter as the storm unleashes its fury, leaving a trail of destruction in its wake. Emerging from safety, you’re met with a scene of utter devastation—your business reduced to rubble. The image of your business, once full of life, now a wasteland of debris stretching endlessly, is a stark reminder of the destructive power of unforeseen events...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/disaster-recovery-is-now-a-service/

item.title: How Telarus GeoScan Finds Better Network Deals
item.description:
Telarus, a leading telecom brokerage service, introduces GeoScan, an innovative telecom carrier research tool, to enhance its suite of software-based services. This new tool allows Telarus consultants to refine carrier service offerings for clients through a more efficient search and evaluation process. By pinpointing the closest matching offers, Telarus agents can better serve their client’s specific needs. GeoScan addresses the need to manage a rapidly expanding pool of carrier options. Telarus’ existing GeoQuote process, known for finding and organizing services from various carriers, faced a welcome challenge: increased carrier participation and a transforming telecom landscape...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/how-telarus-geoscan-finds-better-network-deals/

item.title: Ciena Takes New Bandwidth Technologies On The Road
item.description:
Today, June 29th, those in Waltham, MA can experience cutting-edge carrier bandwidth technology firsthand. Visit the Ciena Innovation Lab to see live demonstrations of their latest optical, Ethernet, and software solutions. The lab will move to its next location in White Marsh, MD on July 15th. What exactly is the Ciena Innovation Lab? It’s a mobile showcase housed in a semi-trailer, packed with the most recent advancements in telecom and networking...

item.title: Telarus, the New Face of Telecom Sales
item.description:
The telecommunications industry is undergoing a massive transformation thanks to disruptive technology. Wireless technology is shaking up the century-old wireline business, VoIP is changing the landscape of the digital voice trunking business, competitive fiber optic carriers are challenging the dominance of established phone companies, and Ethernet and IP networks are blurring the lines between local and wide area networks. Despite these technological advancements, the sales and marketing processes for business telecommunications services have remained largely unchanged...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/telarus-the-new-face-of-telecom-sales/

item.title: XO Launches SIP for Multi-Location Businesses
item.description:
XO Communications, a large telecommunications company, has introduced a new solution that allows businesses with numerous locations to take advantage of enterprise VoIP technology. Connecting business locations to a phone service provider through SIP trunking is a well-established method for improving network performance and saving money. XO is building on this concept with a multi-site SIP trunking solution. Instead of requiring each location to connect to a remote service provider separately, branch offices, warehouses, and other locations can now use their existing Wide Area Network (WAN) to connect SIP phones back to a central IP-PBX system at the main office...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/xo-launches-sip-for-multi-location-businesses/

item.title: Computing In The Cloud
item.description:
The term “cloud computing” has become ubiquitous, but what does it entail and what are its advantages over traditional data centers? Initially, cloud computing provided access to a network of computers for tasks that exceeded the capabilities of individual resources. A prime example is the SETI@Home program, which harnesses the idle processing power of countless personal computers connected through the internet to analyze radio telescope data in search of extraterrestrial life...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/computing-in-the-cloud/

item.title: Why International MPLS Connections Make Sense
item.description:
Businesses with multiple branches, even those with only two, are realizing the benefits of MPLS network services for domestic and global connections. Let’s explore what MPLS offers, particularly for international connections, and why it’s a practical solution even for single-link setups. Multi-Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) is a network technology designed to carry data for numerous users while maintaining security, service quality, and crucial network attributes such as bandwidth, latency, jitter, and packet loss...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/why-international-mpls-connections-make-sense/

item.title: Expand Your Telecom Services Line Card
item.description:
Instead of physical cards, a “line card” in telecommunications sales refers to the range of products and services your company provides. Expanding this range can attract new customers and increase sales but often involves higher inventory costs, franchise fees, or sales quotas. However, there’s a way to expand your offerings without these burdens, specifically within the professional telephone and enterprise network sectors. This opportunity involves selling wireline telecom services. While you might already provide clients with handsets, PBX systems, network equipment, installation, and training, they might be purchasing telecom services elsewhere at a higher cost...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/expand-your-telecom-services-line-card/

item.title: 100 Mbps Colocation Center Bandwidth
item.description:
Businesses frequently turn to colocation to avoid the financial burden of owning and operating their own data centers. A major advantage of colocation is access to high bandwidth at significantly reduced costs. ](http://www.etherrabbit.com/)Colocation centers, or colos, are facilities that house the data center needs of numerous businesses. Maintaining a server farm involves considerable infrastructure and resources, including servers, network equipment, racks, power, cooling, security, and round-the-clock staff. Colocation provides all these elements as a service...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/100-mbps-colocation-center-bandwidth/

item.title: Dedicated Internet Access Via Ethernet
item.description:
Businesses of all sizes now have near-universal access to broadband internet. However, are you utilizing the optimal internet connection for your needs? It might be time to consider Ethernet. Metro Ethernet Networks are rapidly expanding and provide significant benefits to businesses. Cost savings are a key advantage, potentially cutting your internet bandwidth expenses by half or more compared to your current solution. This significant cost reduction comes without compromising reliability or dedicated bandwidth...

item.description:
Businesses are increasingly choosing Ethernet over Copper (EoC) for its impressive bandwidth and affordability. If EoC is an option, its value proposition is quite compelling. item.title: SIP vs PRI Pros and Cons for Business PBX
item.description:
The evolution of business telephone lines has been remarkable, from analog landlines to digital T1 CAS trunks, ISDN PRI, and finally SIP packet-based networks. Interestingly, all these technologies are still in use. Let’s examine the two most common configurations for multi-line PBX business phone systems. ISDN PRI (Primary Rate Interface) ISDN PRI, often shortened to PRI or ISDN PRI, stands for Integrated Services Digital Network Primary Rate Interface. This standard telecom service is based on the earlier T1 line specification...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/sip-vs-pri-pros-and-cons-for-business-pbx/
